paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 gene variant N588K, including clinical significance, patient demographics, penetrance data, and functional studies.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Short QT interval (270–300 ms) at ECG
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The SQTS was diagnosed in 2003. There is a strong family history of SCD in his family. Three members of the family including this patient presented a short QT interval (270–300 ms) corrected with Bazett’s formula (QTc) at ECG.

functional_data.summary: The N588K mutation in KCNH2 leads to a gain-of-function in the hERG channel, impairing inactivation and affecting drug sensitivity.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the family.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is associated with familial SQTS1.
key_quotes: The first gene mutation of N588K in the KCNH2 gene was detected in 2004.
The patient was a 29-year-old male patient when the skin biopsy was performed in 2016.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the KCNH2 variant N588K was successfully extracted.
